resources.string: In this lesson, we will learn some basic phrases.
In this lesson, we will go over pronouns.
In this lesson, we will learn about adjectives.
In this lesson, we will learn about articles and grammatical gender
Note: Bonjour is used between strangers and coworkers, while salut is used between friends.
Note: There are two main differences between French and English pronouns.

1. There are two ways to say you. Tu is singular (used when speaking to one person) and informal (used with close friends and family). Vous is used when speaking to multiple people or when speaking to one person formally (strangers, coworkers, superiors, etc.)
2. There are two ways to say they. Ils is used when speaking about a mixed-gender group. Elles is used when speaking about a group of only female individuals.
Nouns in French can be either male or female. Likewise, adjectives have both a male and female form. Usually, the female adjective is formed by placing an e on the male adjective.
Sometimes, the male and female adjectives look different from one another.
In French, nouns can be either masculine or feminine.
Masculine nouns use the articles le and un. Feminine nouns use the articles la and une.
In addition to articles changing based on gender, they also change based on number. Plural nouns use the articles les and des.
